scheme_data.schemeName: Assam Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme

The govt. will provide a loan subsidy of up to \u20b9 50,000 on education loans to students pursuing higher education.", "age": {"ews": {"gte": 0, "lte": 100}, "sc": {"gte": 0, "lte": 100}, "general": {"gte": 0, "lte": 100}, "obc": {"gte": 0, "lte": 100}, "st": {"gte": 0, "lte": 100}, "female": {"gte": 0, "lte": 100}, "widowed": {"gte": 0, "lte": 100}}, "tags": ["Education", "Loan", "Student"]}, "highlight": {}}
scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is Assam Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme. It is also known as AAELSS. &quot;Assam Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme&quot; was launched on 26 December 2019 by the Hon&#39;ble Chief Minister of Assam. The scheme is managed by the Finance Department, Govt. of Assam. The govt. will provide a loan subsidy of up to ₹ 50,000 on education loans to students pursuing higher education. This scheme would cover all commercial banks like the Federal Bank and HDFC and also the regional rural banks like Assam Gramin Vikash Bank within Assam. The objective of this scheme is to encourage students to pursue higher studies by providing subsidies on education loans. The applicant students can apply for the subsidy by paying 25% of their loans. Only the students who are permanent residents of the state of Assam can apply to this scheme. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Assam. Additionally, the nodal department is Finance Department.

It falls under the categories: Banking,Financial Services and Insurance.

Eligibility criteria include: The applicant student should be a permanent resident of Assam.
The Education Loan should have been availed from any Scheduled Commercial Bank or Regional Rural Bank within the state recognized by the Reserve Bank of India.
The education loan should be a minimum of ₹ 1,00, For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://assam.gov.in/assam-abhinandan-education-loan-subsidy-scheme Description As On The Assam State Portal: https://assam.gov.in/scheme-page/223 Tags associated with the scheme include: Education, Loan, Student.

The name of this welfare scheme is Assam Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme. It is also known as AAELSS. "Assam Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme" was launched on 26 December 2019 by the Hon'ble Chief Minister of Assam. The scheme is managed by the Finance Department, Govt. of Assam. The govt. will provide a loan subsidy of up to ₹ 50,000 on education loans to students pursuing higher education. This scheme would cover all commercial banks like the Federal Bank and HDFC and also the regional rural banks like Assam Gramin Vikash Bank within Assam. The objective of this scheme is to encourage students to pursue higher studies by providing subsidies on education loans. The applicant students can apply for the subsidy by paying 25% of their loans. Only the students who are permanent residents of the state of Assam can apply to this scheme. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. It is specifically implemented in Assam. Additionally, the nodal department is Finance Department. It falls under the categories: Banking,Financial Services and Insurance. Eligibility criteria include: The applicant student should be a permanent resident of Assam. The Education Loan should have been availed from any Scheduled Commercial Bank or Regional Rural Bank within the state recognized by the Reserve Bank of India. sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is Assam Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme.
It is also known as AAELSS.
&quot;Assam Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme&quot; was launched on 26 December 2019 by the Hon&#39;ble Chief Minister of Assam.
The scheme is managed by the Finance Department, Govt.
of Assam.
The govt.
will provide a loan subsidy of up to ₹ 50,000 on education loans to students pursuing higher education.
This scheme would cover all commercial banks like the Federal Bank and HDFC and also the regional rural banks like Assam Gramin Vikash Bank within Assam.
The objective of this scheme is to encourage students to pursue higher studies by providing subsidies on education loans.
The applicant students can apply for the subsidy by paying 25% of their loans.
Only the students who are permanent residents of the state of Assam can apply to this scheme.
The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.
It is specifically implemented in Assam.
Additionally, the nodal department is Finance Department.
It falls under the categories: Banking,Financial Services and Insurance.
Eligibility criteria include: The applicant student should be a permanent resident of Assam.
The Education Loan should have been availed from any Scheduled Commercial Bank or Regional Rural Bank within the state recognized by the Reserve Bank of India.
The education loan should be a minimum of ₹ 1,00, For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://assam.

in/assam-abhinandan-education-loan-subsidy-scheme Description As On The Assam State Portal: https://assam.

ctus.text: The name of this welfare scheme is Assam Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme. It is also known as AAELSS. &quot;Assam Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme&quot; was launched on 26 December 2019 by the Hon&#39;ble Chief Minister of Assam. The scheme is managed by the Finance Department, Govt.

of Assam. The govt. will provide a loan subsidy of up to ₹ 50,000 on education loans to students pursuing higher education. This scheme would cover all commercial banks like the Federal Bank and HDFC and also the regional rural banks like Assam Gramin Vikash Bank within Assam.

The objective of this scheme is to encourage students to pursue higher studies by providing subsidies on education loans. The applicant students can apply for the subsidy by paying 25% of their loans. Only the students who are permanent residents of the state of Assam can apply to this scheme. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.

It is specifically implemented in Assam. Additionally, the nodal department is Finance Department. It falls under the categories: Banking,Financial Services and Insurance. Eligibility criteria include: The applicant student should be a permanent resident of Assam.

The Education Loan should have been availed from any Scheduled Commercial Bank or Regional Rural Bank within the state recognized by the Reserve Bank of India. The education loan should be a minimum of ₹ 1,00, For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://assam. gov. in/assam-abhinandan-education-loan-subsidy-scheme Description As On The Assam State Portal: https://assam.

", "answer": "Yes, this scheme would cover all commercial banks like the Federal Bank and HDFC and also the regional rural banks like Assam Gramin Vikash Bank within Assam.

"}, {"question": "What Are The Objectives Of This Scheme? ", "answer": "The objective of this scheme is to encourage students to pursue higher studies by providing subsidies on education loans. "}, {"question": "Can Students From Other States Also Apply To This Scheme? ", "answer": "No, only the students who are permanent residents of the state of Assam can apply to this scheme.

prompts.ctu_text: The name of this welfare scheme is Assam Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme. It is also known as AAELSS. &quot;Assam Abhinandan Education Loan Subsidy Scheme&quot; was launched on 26 December 2019 by the Hon&#39;ble Chief Minister of Assam. The scheme is managed by the Finance Department, Govt.
